m_szDocTitle: Researchers Cook Up Energy Storage Stew For EV Batteries
m_szDocSumamry: November 9th, 2015 by Tina Casey   The mobile energy storage units — also known as electric vehicles — have been targeted by Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory for a makeover, and those of you who are sceptical about the role that hydrogen will play in powering the car of the future may be in for a surprise. According to the research team, hydrogen could be used to improve lithium-ion batteries, the current gold standard for electric vehicle batteries. Hydrogen In A Li-ion Battery, With Graphene The new energy storage research from Livermore is focused on improving the electrodes of Li-ion
